Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; cream slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 31)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 739, no. 992)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1873) (phase 2)
